text: The 2010 Eneco Tour was the sixth edition of the Eneco Tour cycling stage race. It took place from 17 August to 24 August 2010 in the Benelux. Like the previous years, parts of the Netherlands and Belgium were covered. It was part of the UCI World Ranking. It began with a short individual time trial in Steenwijk and ended with a longer one in Genk. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable" !Stage !Route !Distance !Date !Winner |- |align=right| P |Steenwijk > Steenwijk |5.2 km |align=right| Tuesday, August 17 | Svein Tuft |- |align=right| 1 |Steenwijk > Rhenen |178 km |align=right| Wednesday, August 18 | Robbie McEwen |- |align=right| 2 |Rucphen > Ardooie |198.5 km |align=right| Thursday, August 19 | André Greipel |- |align=right| 3 |Ronse > Ronse |191.8 km |align=right| Friday, August 20 | Koos Moerenhout |- |align=right| 4 |Sint-Lievens-Houtem > Roermond |214.4 km |align=right| Saturday, August 21 | Greg Henderson |- |align=right| 5 |Roermond > Sittard |204 km |align=right| Sunday, August 22 | Jack Bobridge |- |align=right| 6 |Bilzen > Heers |205.6 km |align=right| Monday, August 23 | André Greipel |- |align=right| 7 (ITT) |Genk > Genk |16.9 km |align=right| Tuesday, August 24 | Tony Martin |- |} ==Teams== Twenty one teams have been invited to the 2010 Eneco Tour of which 18 teams are from the UCI Pro Tour {| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:25%;"| * * * * * * | style="vertical- align:top; width:25%;"| * * * * * * | style="vertical-align:top; width:25%;"| * * * * * * |} 3 teams were awarded a wildcard invitation: {| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:25%;"| * | style="vertical-align:top; width:25%;"| * | style="vertical-align:top; width:25%;"| * |} ==Stages== ===Prologue=== 17 August 2010 – Steenwijk (Netherlands), {| |Prologue Result and General Classification after Prologue {| class="wikitable" |- !
